description: From Latin convalēscere, from con- (intensive prefix) + valēscere (“to become strong”), inchoative of valēre (“to be strong”).

verbs.description: convalesce (third-person singular simple present convalesces, present participle convalescing, simple past and past participle convalesced)

entries.meaning: To recover health and strength gradually after sickness or weakness.
examples: The patient convalesced for six months after his stroke.
